meanings.definition: An organization of persons with related interests, goals, etc., especially one formed for mutual aid or protection.
meanings.sent1: The local guild of artists worked together to promote their artwork.
meanings.sent2: The guild of writers held regular meetings to support each other's writing projects.
meanings.sent3: The guild of bakers decided to have a pie-eating contest for fun.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, networking is like being part of a powerful guild.
meanings.sent5: Joining the guild of gardeners opened up new opportunities for learning and growth.

meanings.definition: A medieval association of craftsmen or merchants, often having considerable power.
meanings.sent1: The guild of blacksmiths in the village created exquisite metalwork.
meanings.sent2: Merchants in the guild traded goods from distant lands.
meanings.sent3: The guild of weavers had a friendly competition to see who could make the longest scarf.
meanings.sent4: In the past, being part of a guild meant having influence in the community.
meanings.sent5: The guild of carpenters built the grandest structures in the kingdom.
